title: Sack the House of Lords vermin in ermine who are STILL clocking-in
text:
The House of Lords has been hit by a new expenses scandal (Photo: Getty) Share Get politics   Thank you for subscribing!   
Four years after the Daily Mirror exposed the clocking-in scandal of unelected peers claiming a £300-a-day tax-free allowance without doing any work, we discover the vermin in ermine are still at it. 
What a contemptuous, scandalous abuse of public funds from members of the bloated House of Lords , stuffed with insufferable, pompous, privileged, self-important cronies. 
Former Lords Speaker Baroness D’Souza must name the peer who left a taxi running outside Parliament while they nipped inside to claim their £300 allowance. 
If she insists on protecting the scoundrel, an inquiry should be launched by Parliament’s authorities and, if they refuse, by the police. 
Abuse of public cash is intolerable when 19 million Brits, 30% of our nation, survive on less than what is needed for a half-decent life. 
Many peers are respectable, credible, authoritative politicians who perform an important role scrutinising and revising legislation, as they are currently doing on Brexit . 
Decent peers have as much interest in weeding out the worst among them as we do. Like us on Facebook
